result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc J Strauch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs on each count. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 12 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through Petition by Dept. of Corrections.

defendant.name: Strauch, Marc J
defendant.address: 704 W Walnut Dr, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from State advising of no objection to commuting length of probation on Count 2
from DOC re: corrections necessary to Count 2. Per Court, amend JOC; 1 year max. on the misdemeanor.
from State to Clerk advising that restitution has been paid in full.

Defendant Marc J Strauch in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on repeater status/PTAC. Defendant agrees and understands. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Marc J Strauch in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant is not prepared to enter plea, probation is contemplated, has to find out if that will interfere with work, requests January date. Bond continues as is.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on December 18, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Marc J Strauch in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that case be set for plea.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for November 3, 2014 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.

Defendant Marc J Strauch in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Preliminary hearing on October 1, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Marc J Strauch in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Reetz asks court to set matter for preliminary hearing, continues to waive time limits for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond remains in effect.
No contact direct or indirect with BS, LC, 7037 CTH J, Forestville, WI.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Marc J Strauch in court with attorney Brett E. Reetz.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.
from Defense adiving that they will accept service of summons and complaint
